Params: {3: 'The blinding array of lights flickers on. The silhouette at the table remains perfectly still, stoically awaiting the coming interrogation.'}
{2: 'Science Council', 3: 'Dominik, you will now provide your testimony regarding the M.I.N.D. technology. The Science Council is here to render a fair judgment on your actions.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'The M.I.N.D. is merely a component. A new substrate for human consciousness, built upon a virtual neural array structure.'}
{2: 'Science Council', 3: 'Did you foresee that this technology would lead to such devastation?'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'The devastation was not born from the technology, but from human greed.'}
{2: 'Science Council', 3: "Then do you acknowledge your leading role in this? Your research institute at F.O.S. College was established without the World Government's sanction."}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'Would this "World Government" even exist without my support?'}
{2: 'Science Council', 3: 'Even so, you do not have the authority to supersede the government that represents the will of humanity.'}
{2: 'Dominik', 3: 'I must remind you that at the early stage of the project, Constructs were merely a byproduct. A vessel for consciousness, a necessary measure after that calamity.'}
{2: 'Science Council', 3: 'Then, Dominik, can you tell us what the true purpose of the project is?'}
{2: 'Science Council', 3: 'What is the nature of the threat the Constructs pose to humanity?'}
{3: 'Darkness stains the entirety of the visual field, absolute and without form.'}
{3: 'The concept of time dissolves into irrelevance, while the very notion of space feels like a forgotten dream. All is swallowed by a profound and seamless nothingness...'}
{3: 'A sound like the heart of a glacier fracturing, and a hairline crack of light pierces the blackness at the edge of perception.'}
{3: 'Like a blade through taut silk, shards of impossible gold spill through the fresh wound in the void.'}
{3: 'The immutable boundaries shatter without a whisper, and a presence stares out from behind the nothing.'}
{3: "An entity that defies conventional perception drifts in the chaos. It's a raw, writhing mass, peering and observing through the rupture."}
{3: 'Within the rupture, indistinct fragments are scattered, each one glittering like a brilliant gem.'}
{3: 'It gazes upon the light that is an intruder here, its approximation of a mouth contorting, struggling to shape a sound...'}
{3: 'A young child sits on the lawn, a miniature gardening trowel in her hand. Sensing something strange, she looks up toward the sky.'}
{2: 'Mother', 3: "Don't look directly at the sun, Liv. It'll hurt your eyes."}
{3: "Before the child's eyes can feel any pain, a woman's warm, soft hands gently cover them."}
{3: 'The sting from the bright sunlight gradually fades. Sensing her curiosity, her mother adjusts her hands, creating small gaps between her fingers.'}
{3: 'This new way of seeing the world is fascinating. With childlike excitement, she eagerly peers through the gaps.'}
{3: 'In the backyard, everything looks the same as always, yet somehow different through this special perspective.'}
{3: 'The garden is filled with greenery, lush shrubs and fragrant flowers in every corner. Calliope stands at the kitchen doorway, smiling as she watches them.'}
{3: 'Nearby, the old sheep Bell bleats merrily while chewing on something—the honeysuckle flowers Liv had planted not long ago—'}
{3: "Liv's eyes widen in alarm. She wriggles free from her mother's embrace and rushes toward Bell, rescuing the poor seedling from the sheep's mouth."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Mother', 3: "Just a few more minutes, okay? It's almost time to eat.", 4: '2'}
{3: "The woman follows with a smile, lovingly ruffling little Liv's hair."}
{2: 'Mother', 3: "Alright, we should head back now. It's almost time to eat.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Liv purses her lips in concentration as she cradles the rescued seedling. She carefully digs a perfectly sized hole in a shady spot, then patiently replants her precious flower.'}
{2: 'Little Liv', 3: 'Grow up big and strong, okay?', 4: '1'}
{3: "She solemnly pats the soil firm around the seedling's roots."}
{3: 'The faint sound of bells chimes from within the house.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Calliope', 3: "Little Miss? Little Miss? It's time to eat...", 4: '18'}
{3: "Through the shrubbery, Calliope's voice calls from the kitchen."}
{3: 'The heavy quartz clock strikes with its slightly rusted pendulum.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Little Liv', 3: "Oh, it's time to eat already... Sorry, Callie, I'm coming right away—", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The moment she rises to her feet, a chaotic beam of light pierces the azure sky. In an instant, the world around her is swallowed by a blinding, silent white.'}
{3: "The old sheep's bleating is severed mid-cry. Liv forces her eyes open, only to find that Bell, who had been peacefully grazing on the lawn, has utterly vanished."}
{3: 'Calliope, who was walking toward her, dissolves into the light, along with the honeysuckle flower at her side.'}
{3: 'Bewildered, Liv reaches out, but her hand closes on nothing but empty air.'}
{3: 'The world dissolves from the distant horizon. Darkness breaches its restraints, racing toward her feet.'}
{3: 'Her mother stands at the boundary between light and shadow, gazing at her with gentle eyes, a soft halo radiating from her silver hair.'}
{3: 'The child stumbles forward, but the rapidly spreading shadows seize her ankles...'}
{3: 'Her visual module rapidly auto-adjusts, calibrating to the current environment.'}
{3: 'She is sitting alone on a speeding train.'}
{3: 'Verdant vines brush against her ankles; soft, warm light fills the car.'}
{3: 'Fragments of bewilderment flicker in her pupils. Liv presses her lips together, hesitating a long moment before finally turning to the window.'}
{3: 'Outside, sunshine bathes a garden where green grass carpets the ground.'}
{3: "Yet her eyes don't clear; instead, they grow even hazier."}
{3: 'As the train pushes forward, new visions materialize outside the other windows.'}
{3: 'Countless shards of dreams float outside—a garden, sheep, and... her mother.'}
{3: 'Honeysuckle flowers, Bell, a long-haired woman with an indistinct face... The windows act as dream-catching grids, firmly trapping these fragments outside.'}
{3: "Muttering, Liv presses her palm against the window, gently caressing the glass. It's unclear if she means to touch the visions or if the gesture is purely unconscious."}
{3: 'Then, like biting into an unripe orange, a wave of bitter-sour discomfort surges from the depths of her M.I.N.D.'}
{3: 'The train slices through the intricate layers of clouds, a shard of reality pressing onward through a kaleidoscope of dreams toward its unknown destination.'}
{3: 'The last light of a setting sun washes the Gray Raven lounge in a deep, honeyed gold.'}
{3: 'In the quiet stillness, Liv stirs, her eyelids fluttering open as she emerges from the drowsy depths of a dream.'}
{3: 'She pats her forehead, her brow furrowing in a wave of self-reproach.'}
{3: 'She had barely begun her turn cleaning the lounge when a sudden wave of lethargy pulled her under, leaving her slumped in a chair and powered down.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "To dream of my childhood... It's been so long...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Liv strains to recall the fading details, a quiet surprise settling over her.'}
{3: 'How long has it been since she last dreamed of those days?'}
{3: 'Ever since the battle against the twins and her transfer to the Empyrea frame, countless memories of her past have been lost.'}
{3: 'The persistent migraine stands like a gravestone, marking where her memories began to shatter into fragments.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Her face... It's getting harder to picture it.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'In her dream, the face of the silver-haired woman had grown indistinct.'}
{3: "All that remains is the memory of her mother's unique fragrance of fresh grass, and the gentle warmth of her voice as she read fairy tales."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Liv leans back in her chair, silently searching through the shards in her M.I.N.D.'}
{3: 'The adaptation of her new frame is nearly complete, and the M.I.N.D. migraine has lessened considerably. Is that why these memories have surfaced now...?'}
{3: 'Speaking of her new frame, the Science Council has already sent the replacement notification to her terminal. Once the adaptation period is over...'}
{3: 'The lounge door slides open with a soft hiss, followed by the familiar rhythm of footsteps in the corridor.'}
{3: 'She sets down her cleaning tools and hurries over.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: '...Oh, yes, I got the notice for the frame switch. The Science Council says the adaptation period for this frame will be about two months...', 4: '18'}
{3: 'Soft murmurs of conversation begin to drift from the living area.'}
{3: 'And as the sun finally dips below the horizon, a mechanical spider, no bigger than a fingernail, scuttles nimbly into the deepening shadows of a corner.'}
